document.docAuthor: Lopes, Marcela Paes De A. M. & Mermudes, José Ricardo M.
document.masterDocTitle: Four new species and new synonymy in Stenocerus Schoenherr, 1826 (Coleoptera, Anthribidae, Anthribinae, Stenocerini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Four new species and new synonymy in Stenocerus Schoenherr, 1826 (Coleoptera, Anthribidae, Anthribinae, Stenocerini)

mods:name.mods:namePart: Lopes, Marcela Paes De A. M.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type locality
"Prov. Minarum." (presumably Minas Gerais , Brazil ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Stenocerus fulvipes Lacordaire, 1866: 524
( lapsus for
fulvitarsis
).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Stenocerus paraguayensis
Jordan , 1895
: 167
;
Jordan , 1906
: 320
; Wolfrum, 1929: 34 (cat.);
Valentine, 1980 : 290
(rev.);
Rheinheimer, 2004 : 38
(cat.); syn. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Jordan (1895: 167)
described
Stenocerus paraguayensis
based on the female holotype ( Figs. 57–59 ) from
Paraguay
and wrote: “
St. fulvipedi Germ. Colore simillimus. Multo minor; prothorace cavina laterali leviter sinuata antice rotundato-prominente; elytris dorso ad suturam multo profundius impressis, basi post scutellum ante depressionem fortius transverse elevatis; processu intracoxali mesosterni latissimo, altitudine fere duplo latiore, perpendiculari, margine supero rotundato incrassato
”. He stressed some comparative differences with
S. fulvitarsis
, based on the wide and thickening of the apical margin at the mesosternal process, but we found this broad width at the apical margin occurring clearly in seven species of
Stenocerus
(
S. frontalis , S. nigrotessellatus , S. longulus , S. fulvitarsis
and the two new species described herein,
S. christus
and
S. fratris
).

Valentine (1980) already suspected that
S. paraguayensis
was an abnormal specimen of
S. fulvitarsis
or it represented a geographical variation of that species, because he noticed that it resembled
S. fulvitarsis
in most features, except for the rostrum unicarinate and prosternal process not exceeding the coxal margin posteriorly. He also mentioned that there are another two specimens with the same labels together with the holotype , but with the rostrum tricarinate and prosternal process exceeding the coxal margin posteriorly.

The examination of the type material of
S. paraguayensis
deposited at the BMNH and also the ample series of material of
S. fulvitarsis
from different collections allowed for establishment of the present synonymy. The type material of
S. fulvitarsis
was not found in MNHN , Paris.

The characters presented by
Jordan (1895
, 1906 ) and Valentine (1980) in the characterization of
S. paraguayensis
can be found in
S. fulvitarsis
, for example, the mesosternal process ( Figs. 60–61 ) is very wide, anterior margin swollen and rounded, not concave at front and rostrum uni- or tricarinate ( Fig. 62 ). These characteristics are in fact intraspecific variations of males and females and also large and small specimens.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type material
: Holotype female examined ( Figs. 57–62 ) deposited at BMNH : from Paraguay , Dr. Bohls leg., Karl Jordan col., B. M. 1940-109.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 57–59 .
Stenocerus paraguayensis
Jordan, 1895, holotype female, BMNH (new synonymy of
S. fulvitarsis
): 57, dorsal; 58, lateral; 59, original labels.
